intro: Cota oxylepis, commonly known as the African cota, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb with hairy stems and opposite leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a central disc surrounded by ray florets. Cota oxylepis is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
